title: Airplane nose art font?
content:
This font comes from nose art from a WWII fighter plane that I'm trying to redraw. Any ideas? ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214062228im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/47947.jpg)

 [‹ Aromas Cafe Font](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214062228/http:/www.typophile.com/node/6472 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Giants Anime Coming - Dominator {Brandee} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214062228/http:/www.typophile.com/node/6454 "Go to next forum topic")
author: jroden144

comments.content: Clearly anything painted on an airplane in WWII wasn't done using a computer font. So that means you are looking for a font that might help approximate this lettering. [Clarendon Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214062228/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/clarendon/condensed/?PREFS_SET%5BRenderSize%5D=36&PREFS_SET%5BRenderString%5D=ILL%20WIND) isn't quite as squared off, but it might work, and it is based on a design that is old enough to have been around as a model for this lettering. Another more popular style from the era is [Cheltenham Extra Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214062228/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/cheltenham/).
